title: Mobile Learning Curriculum for American Service and Arrangement Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Service Task Understanding and Digital Device Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Emphasizing hands-on education using mobile learning media and acquiring service skills applicable in real-world settings

learning_goals: Learners can perform the 5-step American service protocol (greeting, order taking, food serving, payment, and farewell) with 85% accuracy.
Learners can design and implement three types of restaurant layouts by applying table-setting and spatial arrangement principles.
Learners can complete 10 service scenarios via a mobile learning platform and achieve an average evaluation score of 90 or higher.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
